653980778.name: Amazing walk in nature.
653980778.author: a TripAdvisor user
653980778.reviewBody: A must see specially if it\'s snowing a bit because the lake inside the crater get frosted.  Loved the walk with the chilly aire yet the sun shinning down on us.  Beautiful plants and flowers on the way to the crater.  There is a parking lot near son you don\'t have to hike all the way up, yet the hike is very entertaining too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Temascaltepec Km 18 San Antonio Acahualco

587282325.name: MInd blowing visit to a magnificent Volcano
587282325.author: a TripAdvisor user
587282325.reviewBody:
This is the highest place on the planet you can arrive by car.
If planning to stay around the alpine refuge, and only go to see the crater lagoon it is suitable to all the family. but not for very small kids
If you are planing to climb to the top, you need to be in good physical shape, good endurance and have some basic equipment such as good hiking boots, jacket, small backpack to carry food and water, sun block, a hat, sunglasses.
The climb to the top (4690 meters) Takes a full morning, and to come down the rest of the afternoon. 
Magnificent place that makes you realize how small we are, and how wonderful life is.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Temascaltepec Km 18 San Antonio Acahualco

536898876.reviewBody: Best place in Toluca. But if you want to go there you have to get up with the car around 8 o\'clock in the morning because around midday the clouds are coming and you don\'t see much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Temascaltepec Km 18 San Antonio Acahualco

525726563.author: a TripAdvisor user
525726563.reviewBody: The Nevado de Toluca or the Volcano of Toluca in english is a truly amazing place where you go and really relax.\n\nIt\'s a one day trip to fully feel the place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Temascaltepec Km 18 San Antonio Acahualco

642702268.author: a TripAdvisor user

They also have an amusement park for the kids they will love. Snacks places inside, and outside there are restaurant s with delicious tipical Mexican food. I recommend this place to visit any time of the year.

The highlight of this trip is definitely the safari and feeding the giraffes by hand! The only bad thing about the place is the food. It\'s all junky fast food and sloppy pizzas. 501646130.name: Nice
501646130.author: a TripAdvisor user
501646130.reviewBody: It is very clean. The cathral has great architecture. People very friendly and helpful with directions.

448158828.name: Go visit
448158828.author: a TripAdvisor user
448158828.reviewBody:
19°17'33.28"N  99°39'24.72"O

This is also called Plaza Civica. It is named martires because in this plaza, 100 indigenes were gunned down. This was in 1811 during the war for the independence of Mexico from Spain.

It is usually very large with fountains and statues but when we were there, the display of the Sistine Chapel took most of the space. This was the reason for our visit to Toluca.
This is an exact replica, in form and content, of the Sistine Chapel in Rome.  It will tour all of Mexico in order that thousands of Mexicans can admire Michelangelo’s work, created 500 years ago and that will allow the public of all ages to get close to one of the masterworks of all time. The technology has enabled to reproduce, through three million photos, each centimeter of Michelangelo’s great work, whose color-schemes were compared to the original in order to offer a unique experience to the public.
Unfortunately, you cannot take photos.

It is directly in front of the cathedral San Jose de Toluca. 

This is the centre of Toluca, with museums, restaurants and government buildings. It is also where the famous Toluca portals start.

Right in front, you can take the bus tour of the city.

635889007.name: Walking distance
635889007.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Calle Reforma y Madero

492889225.name: Awesome place to relax
492889225.author: a TripAdvisor user
492889225.reviewBody: We visited Los Portales de Toluca in June 2017. I went there with my family, teenagers and young children. Everyone had fun. Lots of options to eat snacks. Wet walked and enjoyed the weather. If you want to relax, I recommend this place. It\'s not just one place, it\'s a series of places and stores.

address.streetAddress: Calle Reforma y Madero

483397313.name: Weekends Are Great Time to Visit Here
483397313.author: a TripAdvisor user
483397313.reviewBody: Los Portales de Toluca become a gathering place and show place on weekends and holidays.  On one weekend we observed locals dancing to Samba, Mambo and other dances to recorded music.  Another weekend there were a multitude of artisan booths set up featuring native arts and crafts as well as the usual trinkets for kids.  On both weekends we were there an open-air area had been set aside for entertainment for kids.  There were clowns and other acts to entertain them and they seemed to go on for some time.  Los Portales is located in the center of Toluca near other sights of interest  and adds another interesting thing to see in the city center of Toluca.  Also, as you look around note the brightly colored houses on the hills surrounding the town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Reforma y Madero

468589550.name: Quaint and not to be missed
468589550.author: a TripAdvisor user
468589550.reviewBody: Parking is a challenge so park somewhere nearby then walk. Plan for a few hours and do not bother to carry food. Sample the eateries roam around see the shops and sample the food, drinks and the band and also the art.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

463481433.name: Wonderful afternoon excursion
463481433.author: a TripAdvisor user
463481433.reviewBody: This is an amazing catedral inside and out.  The architecture was awesome.  There seems to be some event happening every time I visit so it is a center of the community and you get to meet interesting locals.  In the Center of town so there are many other things to do very nearby.  And Restaurants galore.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

448356157.name: Rich
448356157.author: a TripAdvisor user
448356157.reviewBody:
19°17'30.71"N  99°39'26.37"W

I always visit the cathedrals whenever possible. Especially in Mexico. So much history is attached to them.

I also visit them for their richness. And the San Jose de Toluca Catedral (San Jose de Nazareth) is a very good example of this. Wood, gold and stained glass abound.

Both exterior and interior are magnificent. And it feels special to walk in it.

See the photos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

444098223.name: Austere and clean
444098223.author: a TripAdvisor user
444098223.reviewBody: The Toluca Cathedral is one of the better kept large churches in Mexico, and is certainly cleaner and more orderly than the Mexico City Cathedral. It has some nice stained glass windows, and a few statues. However most of the walls are bare brick or cement, giving the Toluca Cathedral an austere feel. Orchestra and choral concerts are held here frequently. And yes, Pe\u00f1a Nieto was married here when he was governor - I was present at the ceremony.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

419856309.name: nice structure
419856309.author: a TripAdvisor user
419856309.reviewBody: This Cathedral is also within walking distance in downtown and very beautiful to look at the high ceilings and the paintings on the roof and side walls. very pleasing to watch.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

386808148.name: You must visitar it
386808148.author: a TripAdvisor user
386808148.reviewBody: Beauty catedral. In this place got married President of Mexico with Ang\u00e9lica Rivera. Is a big catedral.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

353116596.name: Pretty cathedral!
353116596.author: a TripAdvisor user
353116596.reviewBody: Biggest church of Toluca, I\'ve never seen it closed, and right in front of it they often make festivals or small carnivals. Definitely worth going around there during Easter!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

307648031.name: An Architectural Gem
307648031.author: a TripAdvisor user
307648031.reviewBody: Absolutely breathtaking! The architecture is amazing and the history astounding. Take lots of photos!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

291887919.name: Tolucas Must See Cathedral
291887919.author: a TripAdvisor user
291887919.reviewBody: Pretty hard to miss. Located facing the main square with the Palacio Gobierno on the opposite side and Los Portales behind. Inside its cool and quiet and when one sits there or slowly walks around it feels like one is in a medieval story. Lovely architecture and one of the must sees in the Centro Historico of Toluca.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Centro

613662177.name: Must go for a Home Game
613662177.author: a TripAdvisor user
613662177.reviewBody: Easy to access, great food vendors outside for pregame and post game. Very safe stay and family oriented. Cold beer galore. Great view to the fiend from any seat.

address.streetAddress: Barrio San Bernardino

543679546.name: Not that modern
543679546.author: a TripAdvisor user
543679546.reviewBody: As a Toluca Fan, I have been going to this stadium for more than 35 years, the first remodel took place before the 1986 World Cup. After that remodel phase little had been done to the stadium... as far as I am concerned on the Palcos grandstand, no major changes were made, no electric staircase, no elevators, a change in seats, some paint, and that\u00b4s it... even with the the whole remodel, Palcos suffered a major lack of protections from sun and rain. Of course they added 2 grandstands to each of the other sections, but it does not compare to any professional stadium in the US nor Europe. Everything should be payed in cash since no credit cards are accepted for food nor drinks.

address.streetAddress: Barrio San Bernardino

525298479.name: Tremendous stadium
525298479.author: a TripAdvisor user
525298479.reviewBody: If you have a chance to go to a Toluca Liga MX home game, by all means do it. This stadium is a fabulous experience: modern, perfectly designed for f\u00fatbol, loud, energetic, great food options, super sightlines, urban setting (you can walk from Centro Hist\u00f3rico) and a very active scene (food, souvenirs, etc.) around the stadium. Make sure you exit on the south side (Constituyentes) and then walk down 23 de Septiembre. I wish Morelia had such an amazing stadium.

address.streetAddress: Barrio San Bernardino

569386657.reviewBody: This chico has its own history of old M\u00e9xico , while in construccion of the cathetral ( More then 100 years)

470391074.name: Nice architecture
470391074.author: a TripAdvisor user
470391074.reviewBody: But it is active church. Very impressive interior but as turist I felt inside not proper. It is religoreus place.

605787334.name: Round Pyramid
605787334.author: a TripAdvisor user
605787334.reviewBody: This is an amazing archeological site to see a rare pyramid that was overseen but multiple cultures.  Yes, it has been repaired/ restructured to allow the visitor to truly understand the pyramid and the growth over time.\n\nIt\u2019s worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

538979879.name: Historical and archaeological
538979879.author: a TripAdvisor user
538979879.reviewBody: Very interesting and well preserved.  Just a pity that the museum was closed and I could not visit the museum.  Information on the place is also not easy to find so it is a bit difficult to find out what it was all about. I was lucky to have a local with me that has a very good knowledge of the historical value.  It is also difficult to get to all 4 sites if you don\'t know the area.  I would recommend that visitors that are interested in visiting these sites make use of a knowledgeable person/guide to take you.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

437235936.name: Interesting pyramid with internal chambers
437235936.author: a TripAdvisor user
437235936.reviewBody: We were staying in Toluca, the hotel told us the only way to get here was by taxi. This we did but.....there are regular buses from Toluca to the town, more fun and a fraction of the price.\nThere are 4  pyramids, we only saw 2, when we arrived the man was there to take our money (50 pesos each) but the museum was closed (Monday- all attractions close on a Monday in Mexico) \nDespite that, a wonderful, well maintained  site, left to our own imaginations.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

353104014.name: Small site but gorgeous!
353104014.author: a TripAdvisor user
353104014.reviewBody: It\'s a small archeological site compared to others I\'ve been, but the temple it\'s gorgeous and since its in the city and very accessible, it\'s definitely worth it! The cops on their horses even have my son a ride!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

340847316.name: Hidden gem!
340847316.author: a TripAdvisor user
340847316.reviewBody: We visited last year but I just got around to writing my review. We went there on a Monday around noon and we were the only visitors there which gave us a chance to really enjoy our visit and no lines. We have been to some of the the major archeological sites in Mexico (Chichen-Itza, Teotihuacan and Cholula) but I liked this one better in particular the circular pyramid which used to be an observatory. The site itself is very small but there is a different vibe to it. You can do it a half a day excursion if you stop and walk around the little town for a bit or refreshments.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

326123070.name: One of my favorites pyramids in M\u00e9xico
326123070.author: a TripAdvisor user
326123070.reviewBody: This is a very good place to visit, never had to make a line to get in, I love the pyramid in honor of the God of the wind, a circular beautiful construction.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Toluca 12 km

474407707.name: Amazing!
474407707.author: a TripAdvisor user
474407707.reviewBody: I absolutely loved it! I\'m not an art expert or anything, but I enjoyed so much looking at the paintings shown here. I also liked learning a little more from the technique and the people whose work I was admiring.\n\nThis visit was not in my plan, but I\'m so glad I found the place and decided to go in.

address.streetAddress: Calle Melchor Ocampo 105 Barrio de la Merced

349234524.name: Mexican Watercolors
349234524.author: a TripAdvisor user
349234524.reviewBody: This museum is in an old home fronting a lovely park set among mature fresnos (ash trees).  The fairly small rooms are usually focused on a single Mexican watercolorist, with  information about the artist, and a padded bench to sit upon while appreciating his/her works.  Natural light from the large old windows is augmented by lighting which goes on as one enters the room.  This museum is one of seven within walking distance of each other, near the center of the city, which are included in the "Ruta del Arte" brochure available at our hotel.  Of course we are familiar with watercolor in general, but this was a delightful introduction to Mexican watercolors.

address.streetAddress: Calle Melchor Ocampo 105 Barrio de la Merced

553198457.name: Intense, informative, and unique
553198457.author: a TripAdvisor user
553198457.reviewBody: This museum is different from the standard experience. Exhibits are arranged sequentially, and the visitor is guided through by an mp3 Audioguide which is provided by the museum and included in the ticket price. Realistic mannequins act out scenes from the Inquisition in rather gruesome detail (I definitely wouldn\'t bring kids under 14 or 15 years old).  From the moment you enter the museum, there is strong, creepy, solemn ambiance. The Audioguide in English had several grammatical errors, but this did not interfere with understandability. I learned A LOT and thoroughly appreciated my visit. I walked out of there speechless.

address.streetAddress: Calle Santos Degollado 109 Barrio de Zopilolcalco

479732301.name: Okay, but not my favorite
479732301.author: a TripAdvisor user
479732301.reviewBody: This is an interesting museum.  The guided walking tour is a bit long.  Some of the "stations" where you stop and listen to the content has nothing to really look at.  Those exhibits that do have something to look at, the mannequin\'s are very lifelike.  The history of the inquisition is very interesting, but this should be a 30 minute tour rather than 1 hour+.

address.streetAddress: Calle Santos Degollado 109 Barrio de Zopilolcalco

491121262.author: a TripAdvisor user
491121262.reviewBody:
It's a small Mall located side by side with the Holiday Inn in an Industrial area in Toluca. 

There are only local stores (no international brands). The food court is nice, with many options.

You have also a supermarket to buy some groceries to eat on your hotel room.

address.streetAddress: Miguel Aleman Aeropuerto 55

435178008.author: a TripAdvisor user
435178008.reviewBody: Moderately crowded. Good range of food, mobile, clothes and other shops. Not the best but not the worst

address.streetAddress: Miguel Aleman Aeropuerto 55

421622553.name: Everything available
421622553.author: a TripAdvisor user
421622553.reviewBody: You have most everything you need under one roof. A decent place just spend sometime for food or to catch a movie or jus go shopping ..

address.streetAddress: Miguel Aleman Aeropuerto 55

457957556.name: Nicely rennovated
457957556.author: a TripAdvisor user
457957556.reviewBody: The new and improved Teatro Morelos has been open for a year or so, and is a nice improvement with more comfortable seats and more modern decor and furnishings. The parking lot is too small, so be sure to arrive early to find a spot.

address.streetAddress: Calle Aquiles Serdan s/n Centro

457181420.name: Good prices!
457181420.author: a TripAdvisor user
457181420.reviewBody: After hearing about this Plaza for years from friends and colleagues, I finally came here looking for an external CD reader/writer. Office Depot had one model for 900 pesos, Office Max for 1300 pesos. Here I found one for 495 pesos! It\'s an off brand, but it works perfectly well and is just what I needed. They even made me a factura for taxes. I used the underground parking, which was a bit old and dirty, but was close and uncrowded. I will be back!

356636801.reviewBody: You can find some computer hardware to cover simple needs. If you need recently delivered or superior hardware you need to go somewhere else, as Plaza de la Tecnologia CDMX or specialized computer shops in CDMX.

645990888.reviewBody: Es uno de los museos m\u00e1s grandes de la Ciudad de M\u00e9xico, te permite conocer la historia del pa\u00eds. Durante el a\u00f1o tiene exposiciones temporales de diferentes pa\u00edses.

address.streetAddress: Centro Cultural Mexiquense, Boulebard Jesus Reyes Heroles 302 San Buenaventura

640736505.author: a TripAdvisor user
640736505.reviewBody: El museo cuenta con una excelente exposici\u00f3n de antropolog\u00eda e historia, incluyendo muestras de la regi\u00f3n y tambi\u00e9n cuenta con espacios en los que se realizan actividades culturales como ver alguna obra de teatro o alg\u00fan musical, los fines de semana realizan talleres para todas las edades. Excelente alternativa cultural.

address.streetAddress: Centro Cultural Mexiquense, Boulebard Jesus Reyes Heroles 302 San Buenaventura

602708000.name: Cultura e historia
602708000.author: a TripAdvisor user
602708000.reviewBody: El museo est\u00e1 bien y tiene cosas buenas, hay m\u00e1s grandes pero este no se queda atr\u00e1s, bastantes exhibiciones de calidad y dentro del centro cultural podr\u00e1s encontrar m\u00e1s actividades e instalaciones que visitar, lugares cercanos para comer no hay

address.streetAddress: Centro Cultural Mexiquense, Boulebard Jesus Reyes Heroles 302 San Buenaventura

556520839.name: el preferido desde mi ni\u00f1ez
556520839.author: a TripAdvisor user
556520839.reviewBody: enorme museo una amplia y variada exhibici\u00f3n todas las piezas son impresionantes es muy tranquilo el lugar hay que ir con ropa c\u00f3moda por que te llevaras toda la tarde si puedes contrata el paquete de audio tour para agilizar el tiempo.. lo bueno es que tiene muchas bancas para descansar por que si esta largo.

address.streetAddress: Centro Cultural Mexiquense, Boulebard Jesus Reyes Heroles 302 San Buenaventura

491107426.name: Ideal para saber mas sobre el Estado de M\u00e9xico
491107426.author: a TripAdvisor user
491107426.reviewBody:
Este Museo esta ubicado dentro del Centro Cultural Mexiquense, a 15 minutos del centro de la Ciudad de Toluca.
Es un Museo con información de historia y antropología muy interesante, sobre el Estado de México. 
Hay piezas muy interesantes, maquetas y audiovisuales.
Lo recomiendo para visitarlo con la familia y con niños de mas de 5 años.
Puedes recorrerlo en 2 o 3 horas, dependiendo de tu interés.
El costo de admisión es de $ 10.00 pesos para adultos y $ 5.00 para niños.
Recomiendo considerar un tiempo de aproximadamente 1/2 día, para visitar los otros dos museos, ubicados en el mismo Centro cultural.
Desde la explanada del Centro Cultural, cuando no hay nubes, se tiene un vista preciosa del Volcán Xinantécatl (conocido como el nevado de Toluca).
Suele ser un lugar fresco, sobre todo en las mañanas temprano, o en las tardes. Recomiendo llevar chamarras ligeras o sueter.
Considero que es buena idea, renovar el equipo audiovisual (pantallas), ya que luce obsoleto.

address.streetAddress: Centro Cultural Mexiquense, Boulebard Jesus Reyes Heroles 302 San Buenaventura

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

522042384.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

517419509.name: Gran cantidad de calaveras de chocolate, dulce, tamarindo, etc.
517419509.author: a TripAdvisor user
517419509.reviewBody: Se pone de el mes de octubre a noviembre, y si est\u00e1s de paso por la ciudad en esos meses es una parada obligatoria. Hay gran cantidad de dulces t\u00edpicos como los de leche, frutas, chongos zamoranos, calaveras de chocolate, dulce, tamarindo, etc.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

501073786.name: CALAVERAS Calaveritas calavereando
501073786.author: a TripAdvisor user
501073786.reviewBody: Es una muestra  de puchas puerquitos  dulce de leche  chongos chocolates  dulces de azucar en forma de calaveras hasta con tu nombre. jamoncillos  etc, algunos muy frescos y ricos  y otros no tanto hay que saber escoger, muy rico y si te gusta moverte con mucha gente no faltes los fines de semana, entre semana es mas tranquilo y hay lo mismo ,  debes conocerlo....

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

470438642.name: Un acercamiento a c\u00f3mo se festeja el D\u00eda de Muertos en Toluca
470438642.author: a TripAdvisor user
470438642.reviewBody:
Es un museo que está abierto todo el año (no solo durante el Festival del Alfeñique y Día de Muertos) y es increíble para los niños, ya que tiene muchísimas actividades y aplicaciones interactivas.

En el museo hay fichas informativas, piezas de alfeñique en exposición y juegos para niños y adultos, como la opción de tomarte una foto con una calaverita de azúcar gigante personalizada con tu nombre, el vestirte como catrín o catrina y tomarte una foto, o tomarte fotos en puestos de venta de Alfeñique o ataúdes de alfeñique como si tu fueras un integrante más.

Durante la época de Día de Muertos suelen tener alguna exposición extra que complementa el museo. También suelen tener eventos culturales, como conciertos o recitales, a lo largo del año. La mejor parte para mí son las calaveras de papel maché del tamaño de una persona con las que puedes tomarte fotos y que representan futbolistas, monjas y muchos personajes más.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

469505531.name: Ideal si no visitas Toluca en temporada de muertos
469505531.author: a TripAdvisor user
469505531.reviewBody: Si te interesa conocer la tradicion de la Feria del Alfe\u00f1ique de Toluca pero no vienes en la temporada en la que se instala en los portales, es ideal que visites el museo, es un lugar sencillo pero coqueto y con buenas explicaciones interactivas, hay piezas que originalmente se usan en la feria, detalles hermosos, tienen actividades culturales y talleres (si puedes, consulta cuales antes) aunque no son diario, no abren los lunes como la mayoria de los museos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

456530010.name: imperdible si quieres comprender la tradici\u00f3n del d\u00eda de muertos
456530010.author: a TripAdvisor user
456530010.reviewBody: un museo que, de manera interactiva y amena, permite al visitante la comprensi\u00f3n de las tradiciones mexicanas del d\u00eda de muertos, y muy especialmente, la referida a la confecci\u00f3n de dulces de alfe\u00f1ique.\nAltamente recomendado para visitar con chicos y grandes.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

453908905.name: Buen museo
453908905.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

447231402.name: Conoce lo b\u00e1sico del Alfe\u00f1ique
447231402.author: a TripAdvisor user
447231402.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 peque\u00f1o, pero puedes conocer lo b\u00e1sico sobre el Alfe\u00f1ique, y porque en Toluca se volvi\u00f3 tan tradicional.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

436968572.name: Las calaveras tradicionales de d\u00eda de muertos hechas de alfe\u00f1ique pasta a base de azucar es un \u00edcono
436968572.author: a TripAdvisor user
436968572.reviewBody:
Considero que el conocer la historia sobre la fabricaciones de las típicas calaveras y figuras de alfeñique (pasta de azúcar) es imprescindible.

El Museo del Alfeñique cuenta con cinco salas de exposición permanente que explican la importancia del dulce en nuestra ciudad, a través de un viaje que nos lleva por la tradición gastronómica en nuestro país hasta la historia de la Feria del Alfeñique, pasando por el proceso de fabricación, en las salas que narran con frases, calaveritas literarias y hasta poemas, parte de la tradición del Día de Muertos en nuestro país.

También cuenta con dos salas de exposiciones temporales, una de las cuales está dedicada a Margarita García Luna quien fuera cronista municipal, una biblioteca que será habilitada próximamente y talleres para que los visitantes aprendan a hacer el dulce. 

Considero es divertido igual para los pequeños.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Independencia Oriente 502

474400566.name: Nice place
474400566.author: a TripAdvisor user
474400566.reviewBody:
The place is good to go with family. There are clown shows and some cultural events that are free.

I loved that there were two exhibitions: one of pictures and one of paintings. 

I was there on Saturday and Sunday and the vibe is totally different on both days. Sundays is definitely family-targeted. There were lots of stands with people selling handicrafts and candy, everything local. Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo 5 de Febrero and Nicolas Bravo, Centro

651868722.author: a TripAdvisor user

La exposici\u00f3n se encuentra dividida en cuatro secciones y todas son interesantes, no pasas mucho tiempo para verlas todas.\n     Tiene un cuarto de conferencias donde se realizan diferentes eventos, el acceso es un poco complicado para los que no son de Toluca, as\u00ed que recomiendo investigar las v\u00edas de llegada.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon s/n esquina Alfredo del Mazo

El museo en sí, es muy moderno y bien montado.

Son dos las torres que se ven al llegar a la entrada de Toluca.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon s/n esquina Alfredo del Mazo

650395495.name: Do not miss this most beautiful building with stunning stained glass and fantastic plants

Admission is very good value and I strongly recommend anyone visiting Toluca should visit.

644812485.name: BEAUTIFUL place!
644812485.author: a TripAdvisor user

642701030.author: a TripAdvisor user
642701030.reviewBody: This is a mandatory place to visit. This vibrant colorful work of art is a place one can never forget. It\'s inexpensive and the children and adults will enjoy as well. I recommend visit Toluca only for this place but they other wonderful tourist places as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

638880697.name: Cosmovitral, the sun_man by Leopoldo Flores
638880697.author: a TripAdvisor user
638880697.reviewBody: A great botanic garden is inside cosmovitral, many of flowers came from Asia contries, but the most extraordinay view is the evolution sun-man showed along the cosmovitral windows since his born until  to reach the sun. Leopoldo Flores was the artist who made the design and a lot of people developed this during 1978 to 1980.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

629434572.name: what a beautiful place
629434572.author: a TripAdvisor user
629434572.reviewBody: Its amazing. I didn\'t realize the place was a market 100 years ago. Very well kept and maintained in the middle of all the city hussle. Worth visiting. I did not take any tour guide so did not receive explanations for the stained glass works

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

621306241.name: Cosmovitral magico
621306241.author: a TripAdvisor user
621306241.reviewBody: Last month visit the city of Toluca where in the center of Toluca, the proud capital of the State of Mexico is a building of singular beauty that was conceived to be a market and as a monument to leave testimony of the Centennial achieved by Mexico as an independent homeland, as well as immortalize the Porfiriana period in iron and stone. Today, this building is called Cosmovitral Jard\u00edn Bot\u00e1nico, a space that houses the beauty of nature and the largest stained glass window in the world, the highest national and international representative icon of the Toluque\u00f1os and Mexicans In this place they sell small plants, buy a small cactus to remember and outside there were food stalls and where they sold handicrafts, the stained glass cosmos a very nice place since there are many plants.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

608191585.name: A beautiful garden in a colourful glass house
608191585.author: a TripAdvisor user
608191585.reviewBody: The Cosmovitral botanical garden merits admiration on its own for it\'s wonderfully landscaped botanical themes. however the lovely stained glass building that houses the garden is the truly breathtaking aspect of the experience. A place like no other and definitely worth the visit when visiting Toluca.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

603109555.name: Historical Wonder
603109555.author: a TripAdvisor user
603109555.reviewBody: It\u2019s a botanical garden which by itself is cool but the stained glass murals make this a must stop!  Originally the site of a market, it was brought back to life with the creation of the stained glass mural.  It is something all can enjoy, even when the kids complain that \u201cit sounds boring\u201d!\n\nIn the end they all enjoyed it with the plants, cactus and picture of President Obama!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

593133474.name: Lovely place to visit
593133474.author: a TripAdvisor user
593133474.reviewBody: Loved the overall setup and it\'s maintenance... Located right next to Toluca city centre it\'s a must go if you come to visit Toluca by any chance

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

589795771.name: Fabulous
589795771.author: a TripAdvisor user
589795771.reviewBody: This is the old marketplace. But made into a fabulous green house. All excisting plants in Mexico are on display in all its beauty. The stain glass is the most beautiful i have ever seen. Entry ticket is only 50 euro cents.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

579319394.name: So beautiful!
579319394.author: a TripAdvisor user
579319394.reviewBody: This is an incredible place to visit. You will spend at least an hour wondering around inside the Lush Gardens within the Cosmosvitral. The best indoor Botanical Garden I have ever been to. The stained-glass is simply stunning!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

574709899.name: Beautiful display of glass and plants
574709899.author: a TripAdvisor user
574709899.reviewBody: This is an absolute gem and only costs 10 pesos!  Incredible displays of glass windows and ceiling in what was a building housing a fruit & veg market, and wonderful varieties of local plants and flowers.  Easily found in the main square.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

571389586.name: vivd colours.
571389586.author: a TripAdvisor user
571389586.reviewBody:
in a small quite city near Mexico city named Toluca, set an impressive museum of vitral and botanico.
in the front of the museum  a large entering with vivid  entrance, named "cosmos"
a beautiful huge vitral with verities splendid color mostly in red color. 
inside the botanico garden there are dozens of varieties of spectacular plants of various types. the whole garden is surrounded by huge lovely vitral on various subjects.
if you are staying in Mexico city ,the visit there is worth traveling.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

570020112.name: Cosmovitral
570020112.author: a TripAdvisor user
570020112.reviewBody: It\'s a beutiful place that you need to visit if you come to  Toluca, when I came with my friends it had a cost of $10 MXN per  person. It is a place for all the family and there is a tourist guide who explains the history every half an hour, but it is in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

569385762.name: Wounderful
569385762.author: a TripAdvisor user
569385762.reviewBody: A must, take the guide that explain the meaning of the glass murals, and the plantas that Are there, great with the family

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

567966613.name: Admiring the nature
567966613.author: a TripAdvisor user
567966613.reviewBody: The stained glass mural and botanical garden offers you the oportunity of join the nature, is set in the building\'s huge windows that surround the building and in the ceiling. \nThe spanish guide is very kind and funny

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

567587126.name: Fun and exotic
567587126.author: a TripAdvisor user
567587126.reviewBody:
Located in downtown area this indoor botanical garden has 4 main thematic gardens and amazing stained glass murals and windows.
There are tour guides, but you can visit it by yourself.
The admission is less than 2 dollars and is open from Tuesday to Sunday until 6 pm. It can get crowded, but still there’s plenty space, you can spend 1 hour walking around it and take some great pictures.

It’s a refreshing oasis of nature if you are hanging around Toluca.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

566749924.name: Remarkable
566749924.author: a TripAdvisor user
566749924.reviewBody: This is a must see amazing work or art as well as a view of the cultural historical background of this beautiful area of Mexico. We enjoyed our time in the Toluca area very much.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

559822823.name: once in a life time
559822823.author: a TripAdvisor user
559822823.reviewBody: it is really a fantastic place to visit while in Toluca. we recommend to go by the end of the day when the sun matches the sun vitral

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

553199278.name: Breathtaking stained glass and beautiful gardens
553199278.author: a TripAdvisor user
553199278.reviewBody: For just $10MX you can gain access to an oasis in the industrial city of Toluca. A massive stained glass artwork depicting the struggle between dark and light within humankind wraps around the entire building, which is a repurposed market space. Visit late in the afternoon, from 4-6, to appreciate the long golden rays of sunset beaming through the stained glass. The gardens are also well-maintained and very refreshing after being in a city. There is a big herb garden which I particularly enjoyed touching and smelling. Highly, highly recommend taking an hour to visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

531176942.name: Beautify
531176942.author: a TripAdvisor user
531176942.reviewBody: Los vitrales are spectacular. The botanical gardens were nice. You should focus on the vitrales. You can enjoy of the guided tour which explains the artist concept

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

525707073.name: Pretty Garden
525707073.author: a TripAdvisor user
525707073.reviewBody: I went there last winter and the place was beautiful. It\'s a very small closed garden in the center of Toluca and the entrace fee was 10 Mexican Pesos, approximately 0,50 Euro, which is nothing compared to other entrance fees.\nThe garden had lots of different plants and flowers, from the Mexican desert plants to Japanese koi fish.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

508580797.name: Hidden gem in heart of the city
508580797.author: a TripAdvisor user
508580797.reviewBody: Visited the Cosmovitral with the kids and husband. Lovely little place in the heart of Toluca central. Various plants and flowers on display lovely to admire however not really a good place for little kids they tend to get a bit bored looking at plants!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

502859613.name: Beautiful
502859613.author: a TripAdvisor user
502859613.reviewBody: Huge building. Stained glass on all the walls. Beautiful one when you first walk in. Lots of plants with lots of color. Only 10 pecos to get in. Don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

500969875.name: Landmark spot in Toluca. Must see!
500969875.author: a TripAdvisor user
500969875.reviewBody: Beautiful, creative and colorful artwork. Amazing to know that an old market was renovated with such beauty. You can walk around and enjoy a variety of botanical offerings, water fountains and light.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

492891640.name: Nice tour
492891640.author: a TripAdvisor user
492891640.reviewBody: We visited Cosmovitral in June 2017. The place is not too big but it\'s worth the visit. The tour guide explained the whole thing to us, without his explanation we would\'ve been lost since each window has a special meaning.  A must see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

490660492.name: Obama visited here
490660492.author: a TripAdvisor user
490660492.reviewBody: In 2014 President Obama visited the Cosmovitral, and you can now take a selfie next to his image. The Cosmovitral has long been a peaceful respite in downtown Toluca, and at 10 pesos it can\'t be beat for tourist value. Venus flytraps are for sale at the exit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

486965828.name: Beautiful
486965828.author: a TripAdvisor user
486965828.reviewBody: The Jard\u00edn Cosmvitral is a beautiful place to visit. It will take maybe 30 mins to visit the garden but you can take longer if you sit,relax and enjoy the music and magnificent view. The downside was that the souviner place closed early and was unable to buy something, also the day we went they did not turn the lights on at night.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

483395513.name: Awesome Stained Glass and Interesting Plant Arrangements
483395513.author: a TripAdvisor user
483395513.reviewBody: If you are visiting Toluca, Mexico you should make time to spend an hour or more viisting the Botanical Garden Cosmovitral.  It is located in the city center near the Cathedral and the Governor\'s Palace so can be part of your sight-seeing trip.  The entrance cost is very moderate.  Your first encounter as you enter the Cosmovitral will be the "Burning Man".  There was a line of people waiting to take pictures in front of this impressive work that serves as your introduction to remaining works on the inside.  You will be able to enjoy the variety of well-documented plantings as you also admire the work of the artisans in creating the beautiful stained glass surrounding the entire building.  Enjoy!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

482472869.name: Wow factor
482472869.author: a TripAdvisor user
482472869.reviewBody: I loved the stained glass, amazing. The gardens are just ok. You will need about 30 minutes to enjoy it for 30 pesos

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

479730091.name: Absolutely amazing
479730091.author: a TripAdvisor user
479730091.reviewBody: As an American resident living full time in Mexico, I always love seeing new parts of the country that I have not experienced before.  I was in Metepec for this first time this week and had the pleasure of seeing the botanical garden Cosmovitral.  It was absolutely beautiful.  I would highly recommend a visit here.  This may be one of the most beautiful places I have seen in Mexico as a whole.  Just absolutely gorgeous.

448099880.name: Triple WOW
448099880.author: a TripAdvisor user
448099880.reviewBody:
19°17'36.93"N  99°39'15.67"W

The Cosmovitral is a stained glass mural and botanical garden located in Toluca, Mexico. The building takes its name from the mural which is set in the building's huge windows that surround the building and in the ceiling. The building originally was constructed in 1910 as the 16 de Septiembre Market. It was not until 1975 when the first female Mayor of Toluca, Yolanda Sentíes, had the 16 de Septiembre Market reallocated and successfully gauged enough social and political support to transform the building into a space for art. El cosmovitral was designed by the notable local artisan Leopoldo Flores.
This is the description in Wikipedia. 

It does not do justice to the splendour of this huge garden. The stained glass windows and ceiling are magnificent. They are a representation of man and his relationship with the universe (cosmo). And the the garden is composed of over 500 plants and contains also several pools one of which has fishes, probably carps.

When in the Estado de Mexico or in Mexico itself, this is a must see. It is only 1 ½ hour from Mexico.

Be aware that the entrance is facing the market between Santos Degollado and Lerdo de Tejada streets west of Ignacio Lopez Rayon or Rayon for short.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

440745896.name: Great for couples!
440745896.author: a TripAdvisor user
440745896.reviewBody:
A botanical garden which happens to have almost half an acre of impressive stained glass windows, the combination should be delightful for art lovers and plant lovers alike.

Don't come here in a hurry, and you will have an extremely relaxing hour of taking in in all the plant species, made even more beautiful by the light seeping through the mural, with natural and astral motives in all the colours of the rainbow. 

Also great for young couples on a date, as entry is just $10 MXN ($0.50 USD) and the place has many pretty, quiet places to just sit and chat surrounded by ponds, plants and romantic multicolored lighting. Even the souvenirs are cheap, so it's a budget-friendly attraction, sure to delight.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

439252568.name: Amazing city centre site
439252568.author: a TripAdvisor user
439252568.reviewBody: This place is not well publicised, and indeed the helpful tourist information office is not so easy to find but seek it out. Near the cathedral / city hall in the old centre of town. Small entry fee ( closed Monday) Amazing stained glass, huge panels in a former market hall. Well kept minimalistic garden inside, tastefully done but the splendor is the glass. Take a camera but take time just to look.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

431518960.name: stain glass work is amazin!
431518960.author: a TripAdvisor user
431518960.reviewBody: Botanical garden mixed with beautiful stain glass art.  A must see on a day off! The gardens replicated different places on earth from tropical, japan, desert and more!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

420299104.name: ART NOUVEAU  FOR  EVERYBODY
420299104.author: a TripAdvisor user
420299104.reviewBody:
If you love art Nouveau, don’t miss “Cosmovitral” at downtown in Toluca city. 
Was build at end of XIX century as a "Market" named “16 septiembre”, as it, was funtioning during 40 years, then government move market to another place and keep this nice building as a Botanic Garden. 

At Cosmovitral you will find reppresented duality between: man/woman  -  Angels/demons  -  good/bad  -  day/night  -  life/dead, but without doubts the main and stonning view  is the  “Sun Man” that is located at enter of this amazing building.
  
Toluca is 30 mins from Mexico City – Cosmovitral  is Daily Open – 10:00 to 18:00 hrs. – Cost $10 MXP . Highly reccomended.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

419855428.name: Very beautiful in downtown Toluca
419855428.author: a TripAdvisor user
419855428.reviewBody: This Botanical garden is within walking distance from downtown and offers a wide range of flowers, cactus and trees. The glass paintings at the entrance is very beautiful. there is a nominal entrance fee for this attraction. Not very big, but worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

418644828.name: Great stop on a tour of Mexico State
418644828.author: a TripAdvisor user
418644828.reviewBody: My wife and I had a stop at Cosmovitral on the way to the Piedra Herradura Monarch Butterfly Reserve last February.  I\'m glad this stop was included; I would most likely not have made the trip to Toluca just to see the Cosmovitral.  That being said, it was well worth the time we spent there.  The tour we had was in Spanish, so be prepared to translate if you have some in your group who don\'t speak Spanish.  The story and lore depicted in the stained glass, as well as the story behind the creation of the Museum make this a great tourist attraction.  It was a great stop for us to take in a unique experience and make it an unexpectedly surprising part of a day long tourist package.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

413286835.name: One of the few attractions of downtown Toluca
413286835.author: a TripAdvisor user
413286835.reviewBody:
Toluca is an industrial city, not much to see there.  Most attractions are day trips outside of the city.  Aside from the cathedral and some other churches, this is a nice place to spend some time visiting.

It is a botanical garden, so expect to see vegetation in a greenhouse environment.  The place is a large space featuring a fountain in the middle.  It can get a bit muggy with all that vegetation enclosed.  

The real attraction here are the huge glassworks that surround the place.   They're everywhere!  Beautiful pieces to glance and and take some pictures.  Try to get a guide, some wander around the place.  We did and listening to the story behind the glass work while seeing it sure beats the simple glance.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

413163616.name: Stunning stained glass
413163616.author: a TripAdvisor user
413163616.reviewBody: It used to be the marketplace but the building has been converted into an indoor botanical garden. When you walk in you\'re surrounded by stained glass windows and beautiful plants. The stained glass is along every wall and on the ceiling from the front to the back.  There is a guide that gives an excellent, free, explanation of the glass masterpiece. 8k sq ft of stained glass with over 500,000 pieces of glass. The plants are organized into different ecosystems and gardens. It\'s not the largest garden I\'ve been to, but it is beautiful.  There are a few fountains that add to the peaceful atmosphere. But you really go to see the stained glass.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

411621059.name: Stunningly beautiful!
411621059.author: a TripAdvisor user
411621059.reviewBody: This was my second visit to Cosmovitral. Loved that the flowers were different on this visit. My first trip there was in January 2016 and it was filled with poinsettias, which were a lovely sight. This visit we saw orchids and other spring/summer flowers. I\'ll never get tired of viewing the stained glass. Just breathtaking!

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

408391303.name: Absolutely worthy

The surroundings are really very Mexican, and as in all of Mexico, the people are very kind. Then, when you less expect, there is this place that has beautiful gardens surrounded by this magnificent vitral.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

404617087.name: Awesome and unique!
404617087.author: a TripAdvisor user
404617087.reviewBody: If you can\'t find a reason to visit Toluca, this is it!  A beautiful botanical garden enclosed by a stunning and unique work of art by Leopoldo Flores.  It\'s a steel-framed enclosure set with hundreds of pieces of stained glass imported from all over the world, depicting the dualities of the evolution of humankind.  In all my years of travel, I\'ve never seen anything like it.  Absolutely amazing!

The plants are catalogued but the attraction is not to learn about the plants but to spend a beautiful time resting and enjoying the trees and plants around with while "discovering" the creatures and meaning behind the glass. It is quite a place, you can spend as much time inside as you wish and getting away from the traffic and madness of the capital city into a beautiful environment makes for a delightful rest.

345660646.name: Best in the world

345660646.reviewBody: The gardens are enclosed in an old cement food market building.  They\'re quite nice.  But what you come here for is to see the incredible stained glass murals that encircle the building.  They tell the story of society from its creation to its destruction and recreation.  Read up on it first to increase your enjoyment or get a guide.  Close enough to Mexico City for a day trip.  Don\'t miss it.

260721121.name: Amazing place to see not to be missed.
260721121.author: a TripAdvisor user
260721121.reviewBody: The stained glass is gigantic and beautiful! It tells a beautiful story too. The info booklet is only available in Spanish. Inside the  building there is a beautiful Japanese garden. It is good to combine this attraction with a trip to the Monarch butterfly conservatory since they are close to each other. Paid parking is available closeby.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

260173992.name: Wonderful Place for Photos, Definitely Worth a Visit
260173992.author: a TripAdvisor user
260173992.reviewBody:
When I told people that I was going to Toluca, everyone said: Why? There's nothing there.  

WRONG. Cosmovitral is an amazing place for a visit: not only does it exhibit beautiful stained glass art (the most famous being the Man on Fire), but it also has a great collection of plants in its well-preserved botanical garden.  The space used to be an indoor marketplace, but was converted by the first female mayor of Toluca into its present state.

Definitely worth a visit, and at only $10 pesos for your entrance, a great value, too.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

254972443.name: A world-famous piece of art
254972443.author: a TripAdvisor user
254972443.reviewBody: The Cosmovitral Jard\u00edn Bot\u00e1nico holds the world\'s larger stained glass work. Hundreds of sq feet of colorful images decorating what once was  the  windows of an old market, a building dated back in 1900 and saved from beign demolished during the 1970s.

253026697.author: a TripAdvisor user
253026697.reviewBody: The stained glass in this beautiful Art Nouveau building right on the main town square is so outstanding, you forget that there is a nice collection of plants inside! Toluca is an industrial city, but this highlight makes it a place worth visiting. And, it is not that far from Mexico City.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

249403160.name: Worth a visit, if you are in the area
249403160.author: a TripAdvisor user
249403160.reviewBody:
This building was previously utilised as a market. It was since redeveloped to house a botanical garden with impressive wall-to-wall stained glass artwork.

The whole place is very peaceful and relaxing and depending on the time of the day that you visit, the sun will be shining on different parts the stained glass artwork so you will probably experience a different view or perspective each time.

I wouldn't necessarily drive hours just to go to this place exclusively, but if you are in the area or travelling through the area, then definitely try to visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

248929781.name: Enjoyable side-trip on the way to Monarch butterflies
248929781.author: a TripAdvisor user
248929781.reviewBody:
We used the private tour company, Journeys Beyond the Surface, to take us on a day-trip from Mexico City to the Monarch butterfly biosphere/reserve.  On the way there, we did a pit-stop at this attraction, located in Toluca.  

It was quite beautiful, and worth the stop.  We were there first thing in the morning, and we were the only people in the whole facility.  

Like many places on our trip to MC, the hours of operation were not clear.  They informed our tour company in advance that they would be open on the day in question (December 29th, 2014).  When we arrived, they were closed.  After waiting around for a while, and through the negotiations of our guide, they opened their doors.  This is the only reason I don’t give a 5/5.
  
I would not say this is worth a special trip out of MC.  [But I would say the Monarch butterflies are worth the special trip].  But if Toluca is on your way to something, or if you’re staying in Toluca, definitely check this place out. 

And different times of the day would give you a different perspective of this stained glass palace, as the sun changes position over the stained glass.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

242954903.name: Beautiful garden and vitrales
242954903.author: a TripAdvisor user
242954903.reviewBody: Very nice to relax. The art work on the windows combined with the plants is fantastic. It\'s in the historic center so you have a lot of other places to see near. It\'s cheap to get in and worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

240200913.author: a TripAdvisor user
240200913.reviewBody: Toluca is mostly industrial. So this is an oasis in the area. It is well worthy and deserves to be visited. Request the guided tour-explanation. 1 hour is needed for the visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

238132883.name: One of the few places worth visiting...
238132883.author: a TripAdvisor user
238132883.reviewBody: in Toluca. It was originally a market built in the early 20th century. Some time after the market was closed, the city had the idea to converting block and wrought iron building to an attraction. Artist Leopoldo Flores was commissioned, and he created stained glass panels that cover the upper walls and the ceiling of the building. The most famous panel is the Hombre del Sol, a Da Vinci type male figure in stained glass. During equinoxes, the sun shines right through this panel.  The interior has a non-descript botanical garden.  It is one of the few places worth spending time to example is this drab-industrial city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

198318716.name: Wow, what a surprise attraction
198318716.author: a TripAdvisor user
198318716.reviewBody:
We asked our guide in advance to stop somewhere of interest on route to the butterfly area in Zitacuaro in the state of Michoacán and he suggested this Botanical Garden. It wasn't far from Mexico City. We were not expecting to see this spectacular stained glass window building with the vibrant colors, plants, and the light coming through the picturesque panels. It  was mind-blowing and mesmerizing and truly an architectural feat.
We wandered inside for about an hour and I wish there had been a guide giving a presentation in English since we wanted to know the significance of the birds, evolving of the world, the night and day elements, etc. Even  just to wander and admire was a total experience.

Afterwards, our guide took us to Vaca Negra for a torta lunch with the famed chorizo of Toluca on a roll with melted Oaxaca cheese. Excellent. Vaca Negra is a chain, but one is right near the botanical gardens.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

195689960.name: Very attractive and unique building
195689960.author: a TripAdvisor user
195689960.reviewBody: We did not have time to go inside this special looking building during our one day stop in Toluca. We arrived on a Monday when it was closed so we just walked around the centro historico. Around 10:00 the next morning when it opened we needed to head for the bus station to catch a bus to Morelia. But from reading about it the structure was a market a century ago but was transformed into a beautiful garden. The exterior of the building is covered with very attractive colored glass which made it look quite special. It\'s a work of art. \nDespite all the industry all around Toluca the center of town remains with an old colonial appearance. The Jardin does not fit in so well with other architecture but it is still a fascinating looking building and if we return to Toluca we will definitely go inside for a thorough look. We are sorry that we missed out. \nA week after we were there it was the spot where President Obama, President Pena Nieto of Mexico, and Prime Minister Harper of Canada met and made some announcements. The President of Mexico could not have selected a nicer spot.

161720923.name: A paradise in a rush city Toluca
161720923.author: a TripAdvisor user
161720923.reviewBody: With 45 tons of blown glass in 28 different colors, most of which came from Italy, Germany, France, Belgium, Japan, Canada y US, the impressive green house in downtown Toluca is a paradise in the middle of a rush city, 1 hour west from Mexico city. The building for a local market dates back to 1909 and it was made of iron structure in art nouveau style. From 1975 and on it has been transformed into a full of color green house with a collection of plants, trees & grass from all over the world including the mexican cactus & magueyes. Best of all is the central picture of the man in the circle of fire, that gets marvelous red colors every afternoon, as it is facing west. With enough time to stop at, this can be a great experience for travellers on the way to Morelia & the monarch butterflies.

address.streetAddress: Calle Benito Juarez s/n esq. Lerdo de Tejada Centro

151301386.name: Take The Time To See Toluca\'s Stained Glass Murals!
151301386.author: a TripAdvisor user
151301386.reviewBody:
The Cosmovitral Botanical Garden in Toluca, Mexico is a beautiful building. From the outside, the building resembles an old train station. On the inside, the garden has fountains, plants and a very simple Japanese friendship garden.

Until 1975, the structure was home to Toluca’s main market. It was the first permanent market in the city. Growth brought too much congestion to the area and city leaders decided to relocate the market farther from the city center. Today, the space houses a truly beautiful botanical garden, Japanese friendship garden and of course, beautiful stained glass murals. Together with 60 artists, the lead artist, Leopold, spent five years assembling the beautiful stained glass garden. Incredibly, the building is 2/3 glass, and is made up of 28 different colored pieces of glass.

All of the pieces were imported from Europe, Japan, Canada and the US. 

The main attraction is “El Hombre del Sol” or the “Man of the Sun” mural. Concepted and executed by artist Leopoldo Flores, the work depicts Leopold’s interpretation of “Man and his relationship with the Universe”. The mural is beautiful, complicated, and inspiring. Our guide told me that on the Spring Equinox, the man and the woman line up with the sun and create a dazzling display. Toluca hosts concerts and often, the artist himself will attend.

146729758.name: Spectacular and Worth the Time in Toluca
146729758.author: a TripAdvisor user
146729758.reviewBody:
En route to Michoacan, we chose to stop in Toluca to see the famous Cosmovitral. Designed to be a train station and then a market, it is now home to a wonderful botanical garden. In the gardens are many plants indigenous to Mexico. The main attraction, of course, are the wonderful stained glass panels which are quite unique in their theme. For best pics, go on a sunny day and marvel how the glass changes the colors of the plants

What is lacking are more places to sit and just meditate as it is so peaceful...until a school group appears...LOL.

The location is very easy to find, just adjacent to the square. While there, also visit the Governor;s Palace on the opposite side of the square. From this location, Enrique Pena Nieto went on to become this country's current President!
